description: three striding female figures at left, each carrying an attribute: pallet and brushes, building plan, small sculpture; sculpture at right of torch-bearing winged figure holding three foliate crowns; Apollo riding his chariot in the sky overhead preceded by a winged figure
medium: Pen and brown ink and wash with white heightening on laid paper
provenance: [Alister Mathews, Bournemouth, England, until 1974; sold September 8, for Â£40, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1974-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: The Coronation of the Allegories of Painting, Sculpture, and Architecture
